page.title: 19 Freetown
page.content:
Freetown is an area which is now enclosed by the town of Bury but which at one time had an identity of its own.
There are various theories to explain the name of the area. It would seem to have started as a mill development towards the end of the 18th century. The land itself was unusual round here in that it was not owned by Lord Derby or the Church (glebe lands). This seems the most likely reason for the name. However some suggest that it the mills may well have had connections through trade with the Freetown in Sierra Leone.
Nowadays the large mills have been replaced by smaller industrial units concentrating on distribution and light industry.
